Name: Larchmont
Ingredients: 45 ml Light white rum (charcoal-filtered 1-4 years old)
15 ml Grand Marnier or other cognac orange liqueur
7.5 ml Sugar syrup 'rich' (2 sugar to 1 water, 65.0°Brix)
10 ml Chilled water omit if using wet ice
Instructions: Select and pre-chill a Coupe glass .
Prepare garnish of orange zest twist.
EXPRESS orange zest twist over the cocktail and use as garnish.
Review: I share Embury's appreciation of this fine, delicate Orange Daiquiri. However, I've tweaked his formulation as we found the original somewhat rich and over citrusy.
History: Created by David A. Embury, who in his 1948 Fine Art of Mixing Drinks writes of this drink: " As a grand finale to cocktails based on the Rum Sour, I give you one of my favorites which I have named after my favorite community. " Larchmont is a village in Westchester County, New York where he lived for many years.
Nutrition: One serving of Larchmont contains 159 calories
